summary: every year, this pathogen causes 30 million LRTIs and the annual death toll from RSV-related diseases is now 200,000. the virus is able to remain infectious on various environmental surfaces, suggesting fomites as a source of spread. aerosolized ribavirin (a synthetic guanosine analog) is available for treating RSV replication. ribavirin is characterized by a broad spectrum of antiviral activity, potential toxicity, besides relatively high cost. the use of ribavirin is still limited because beneficial effects on clinical outcomes remain unproved. the protein conformational rearrangement results in fusion of the viral and cellular membranes. this conformation of F is considered to be the ideal vaccine antigen. antibody and small molecules that disrupt its structure and function constitute a very active field of research. scheme 2. Synthesis of 5,6-dichloro-1-phenyl-benzotriazole amides 5a–d and 7a–h. scheme 3. MDBK, Hep-2 and BHK cells were seeded at an initial density of 6 105, 5 105, and 1 106 cells/mL, respectively, in 96-well plates containing Minimum Essential Medium with Earle's salts (MEM-E), L-glutamine, 1 mM sodium pyruvate and 25 mg/L kanamycin. cell cultures were then incubated at 37°C in a humidified, 5% CO2 atmosphere virucidal Activity Assay 10d (20 M) was incubated with 1x105 PFU/mL of RSV at either 4 and 37°C for 1 h. titers were determined on vero-76 cells at high dilutions, at which the compound was not active. confluent monolayers of vero-76 cells in 96-well tissue culture plates were infected for 2 h at room temperature with 100 L of proper RSV dilutions to give a final m.o.i. of 1. after each incubation period, the monolayers were washed two times with maintenance medium and incubated with fresh medium until 10 h post-infection. 76 cells in 24-well plates were pre-chilled for 1 h at 4°C. the medium was removed and then serial dilutions of RSV in ice-cold MEM-E were added. the monolayers were washed three times in cold PBS in order to remove unbound viral particles. the presence of bound virus was detected by indirect immunofluorescence. monolayers cultures of vero-76 cells in six-well dishes were infected with RSV. after 2 h of adsorption period, the monolayer was washed with PBS. 10d was added at concentration of 50, 10 and 2 M at 8 h post infection. 72 h post infection cells were examined microscopically for syncytium formation. 293T cells were transfected with plasmid DNA encoding the eGFP-renilla luciferase dual-split fusion proteins DSP17 or DSP811 respectively. one cell population received the plasmid DNA encoding RSV L19F. another cell population was transfected with plasmid DNA coding for Mev F and H proteins for control. the binding free energy, Gbind, between 10d and the RSV F-protein was then estimated by using the MM/PBSA approach implemented in Amber 16. the corresponding Gbind was computed as: G bind = G complex - ( G protein + G ligand - E MM + G SOL - T S bind = H bind - T S bind. TMC353121. the hydrophobic pocket of protomer A (consisting of residues F140, M396, and F488) can properly accommodate the benzimidazole moiety of TMC353121 through favorable hydrophobic interactions. a series of new 5,6-dichloro-phenylbenzotriazole derivatives were synthesized and tested for antiviral activity against RSV. all compounds were generally endowed with high activity (EC50 in the low micromolar range), low cytotoxicity (CC50 in the high micromolar range), and very high RSV selectivity in whole-virus cell-based assays. ELISA data revealed a dose-dependent reduction of viral antigen by 10d at non-cytotoxic concentrations, whist a negligible virucidal effect of 10d was found against RSV virions. 10d effectively inhibited viral infection by hampering the binding and penetration processes of the virus into the host cells. all three protomers were found to be involved in binding 10d via stabilizing hydrogen bonds, - and other hydrophobic interactions, ultimately resulting in an IC50 value of 8.2 M. a comparison with the known and potent RSV F-protein inhibitor highlighted the molecular level the lower potency of this compound.
